intro: Achillea aegyptiaca, commonly known as Egyptian yarrow, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features basal rosettes of grey-green, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or arid environments. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional medicinal uses.
